About

I am a persistent ponderer currently based in Halifax, NS, Canada. I recently graduated from Dalhousie University with a BSc Combined Honours in math and music [May 2014]. My research specialty was graph theory; some of my other mathematical interests include:

  • number theory and cryptography
  • logic and lambda calculus
  • abstract algebra
  • mathematical pedagogy

After realizing that I have little desire to comb the hairy ball of pure mathematics research, I've been exploring the world of programming. It combines my need to define and order things, with my fondness of problem solving and artistic design. I've been working with the following:

  • python
  • java
  • C# and Unity
  • Maple
  • HTML and CSS

Music is my most successful method of communication. I've been studying piano since the age of 7, most recently with Lynn Stodola at Dalhousie University. I enjoy thinking about music in malleable and moving terms.

My other intersts include:

  • dancing argentine tango
  • pencil/pen drawing and pixel art
  • reading fiction
  • greyhounds (the retired racing kind)

Contact : juliatufts (at) gmail (dot) com
